title: Beacon chain crashes when calling gRPC before genesis
body:
Hi,

The beacon node crashed for me when I was using `ValidatorPerformance` and `ValidatorStatus` gRPC services before genesis start.
I was using the latest beacon chain image (ID: `8674833ec5bd`). The crash dump was following:

What command were you running? (steps to reproduce)

Hi @mkinney,

1. Start a beacon node with the demo config and connect it with the eth1 chain where VRC is deployed.
2. Provision validator node and register it in a beacon chain.
3. Use a `ValidatorService` from [services.proto](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/blob/master/proto/beacon/rpc/v1/services.proto) to query a beacon node for the deployed validator public key (I've used [python gRPC](https://www.grpc.io/docs/quickstart/python/) to compile proto files and perform requests).
4. The beacon node should crash with the error above.

The root issue here is that our panic handler is panicking. This handler is meant to capture the panic and gracefully return an error. 

A resolution here would be to fix the panic handler to accept `runtime.errorString` or `string` interface type conversions.
